org.gbif.common.parsers.date

Class DateParseUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.common.parsers.date.DateParseUtils

  • public class DateParseUtils
extends Object
    Utilities for parsing dates. Methods are implemented in static to reduce object creation and shorten coding for clients. It is not anticipated that these methods would ever be mocked in unit tests. Note: The returned date will always be in the systems default TimeZone. BE CAREFUL!

      • isValidUse

        public static boolean isValidUse(String value,
                 DateParseUtils.DATE_FIELD field)
        Utility to check that the field appears valid in it's status use. Day must fall within 1-31, month within 1-12 and year within 1-
        Parameters:
        value - To test
        field - The context that the value is being used
        Returns:
        true or false depending on the validity of the value in it's context

      • isDateCoercible

        public static boolean isDateCoercible(YearMonthDay ymd)
        Checks if a YearMonthDay object maybe represents a valid date in the sense that the date really exists (e.g. no February 31st) As the components of a YearMonthDay may be null it only checks this validity if all components are not null.
        Parameters:
        ymd - to check
        Returns:
        true if it may be a valid partial date, false if it is sure that it is an invalid date.

      • parse

        public static ParseResult<Date> parse(@Nullable
                      String year,
                      @Nullable
                      String month,
                      @Nullable
                      String day)
        Tries to create a valid date (complete or partial) out of three Strings for year, month and day. If all three components are null the parse will fail.
        Parameters:
        year - to parse. May be null.
        month - to parse. May be null.
        day - to parse. May be null.
        Returns:
        result of the parsing

      • normalize

                     String month,

      • inferCentury

        public static String inferCentury(String year)
        Should the year be lower than 100, this will assume it is current century if makes sense, otherwise uses previous century. At time of writing (2010) a value of 1-99 will be treated as 2010, whereas 11 will be considered 1911. Next year, the same code would interpret 11 as 2011. This is not foolproof, but much more likely than the year 0011.

      • normalizeFloat

        public static String normalizeFloat(String value)
        Often values are seen as Float rather than int, due to a database export The year "1978" is actually seen as "1978.0". Where this is detected, the string is normalized to the INT representation
        Parameters:
        value - To check
        Returns:
        the integer value

      • atomize

        public static ParseResult<YearMonthDay> atomize(String input)
        Parses the date and then atomizes it to the year month and day
        Parameters:
        input - To convert to a YearMonthDay()
        Returns:
        The result of the parsing

      • normalizeMonth

        public static String normalizeMonth(String input)
        Often months come in the form Sept. September etc. This will convert many variations into the numerical version
        Parameters:
        input - To normalize
        Returns:
        the normalized month

      • padTo2Chars

        protected static String padTo2Chars(int value)
        Parameters:
        value - To convert into a 2 char String. Must be 1-12 inclusive or else strange results might occur
        Returns:
        1 becomes "01", 5 becomes "05", 10 becomes "10" etc
